content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												Rocksteady should be ashamed that they released the game in this state. Don't be fooled: the problems with this port are not subtle. They cannot be explained away simply by claiming that the issues are uncommon and weren't uncovered by play testing. I have a 980 ti, one of the most high end and expensive cards available for purchase. I had to turn down the settings to achieve a playable frame-rate. In one instant I'll be at 60-70+ fps, and a second later, I'll be at 25, with no difference in the action on-screen. Oh, and don't forget, the only reason I was able to go over 30 is because I manually changed a config file that states any frame rate over 30 will make the game unstable. It blows my mind that a company would release a product in this state. It's all about greed. They are confident they can take your money, release an apology, and take their time fixing the most glaring issues in an economical way. Rocksteady deserves all the negative press they will continue to get, and more.

content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
This review will be changed when Warner Bros re-releases the game and fixes all the major issues. This is why the score is a Not Recommended.


YouTube™ Video: Batman: Arkham Knight [PC Review] 

			Views: 398		

			My review of the broken PC version of "Batman: Arkham Knight", the last installment in Rocksteady's superhero trilogy. ------------------------------- Like on Facebook:...		

Game: Batman: Arkham KnightGenre: Action-Adventure Open WorldDeveloper: Rocksteady StudiosPublisher: Warner Bros. Interactive EntertainmentCopy supplied by NvidiaBatman: Arkham Knight is the final instalment in the open world action-adventure superhero franchise that started in 2009, and is developed by Rocksteady Studios and published by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment.STORYNine months after the events of Arkham City, the Scarecrow developes an improved and deadlier version of his fear toxin and threatens to release it in the city of Gotham. The police evacuates all the civilians and stays behind to arrest all the criminals that are destroying the city and to help Batman capture Scarecrow and the other supervillains (Two Face, Penguin, Riddler, etc.). Also, there is a new enemy in town: the Arkham Knight, someone who built an army and invaded Gotham with the sole objective to kill the Batman.Does this sound interesting? Yes, it does. Is it entertaining? Not really. While it starts strong, the story gets boring really fast: they try to make you care about multiple characters from the comics that barely made cameos in the previous games, the villains do almost nothing at all, the Arkham Knight's reveal is a huge disappointment and the 100% completion ending doesn't make much sense. Fortunately, the saving grace is the presence of an old character that comes back during the game, elevating the quality of the story quite a lot for me.GRAPHICSThe game looks spectacular: huge city full of details and easter eggs, constant rain, beautiful animations and varied environments make this one of the prettiest games ever. However, as we all know the PC version also features missing features and painful optimization: even though I modified the .ini files and used a tweak tool, there are still many problems with the performance. And this is without talking about all the glitches that are present, like enemies disappearing inside walls, objectives that don't activate, entire riots of enemies that run away.Note that this section will be updated once WB and Rocksteady fix everything, but we can't forgive them for this barely playable first release.GAMEPLAYThe melee combat is mostly unchanged: you attack and counter enemies in brawl, while also adopting different attacks depending on which enemy you are fighting. Some nice improvements are the possibility to punch downed enemy without losing your combo, grabbing bats and other weapons to deal more damage and to use environmental kills. In some sections you are also helped by Robin, Catwoman or Nightwing, who are playable for a small amount of time each.The open world is vast and features many tropes of recent Ubisoft games: control a tower, defeat strongholds, find collectibles. Fortunately, the varied environments, vibrant city and multiple side missions make this an enjoyable experience: gliding around the city, finding Azrael, looking for Riddler Trophies, saving firemens and helping the GCPD makes you really feel like you are the Batman.And now, to the most diving section of the gameplay: the Batmobile. When I started playing, I loved it: it runs fast but you always feel fully in control, the combat controls are tight and precise and there are some interesting implementations in some puzzles. However, after 10 hours where you have spent over half of your time shooting tanks and chasing cars, it gets really annoying. The game becomes repetitive, and because of the Batmobile's presence, all of the boss fights have been changed with big tanks to blow up, and stealth sections have been reduced way too much.While there are some nice additions, the side missions are very interesting and varied and the open world is fun to explore, the Batmobile is shoved down our throats and it becomes the most annoying element in the game, sucking most of the fun out of it.CHALLENGEEven though I started on Hard, the game is very easy to beat: I found the fights shorter and easier to win, the stealth sections with many covers and AI that wanders alone, the Batmobile chases repetitive and the tank sections a dodge-and-shoot borefest.SOUNDKevin Conroy, Troy Baker, Jonathan Banks, Grey Griffin and many other voice actors come back to the game, and they all work very well. The sound effects are great as always, as well as having the same powerful punching sound effects. The Batmobile also sounds fantastic, resembling the sounds featured in the Christopher Nolan trilogy. Nick Arundel also comes back as composer, and does a fantastic job enhancing your Batman experience.REPLAYABILITYOpen world full of activities, New Game+ mode, 79 achievements, upcoming DLC and a ridiculous amount of Riddler challenges make this a game that us fans will keep playing for a long time.Overall, I would recommend this game only when its technical issues have been fixed. Right now, the large amount of bugs, poor performance and missing graphical features don't make this a worthwile purchase. Also, the overuse of the Batmobile and uninteresting story will put off many players, making them miss the better paced previous installments. I wanted to love this game. I love all the others, and I went into this with high expectations. Unfortunately, I was disappointed.Story: 7Graphics: 5Gameplay: 7.5Challenge: 7Sound: 8.5Replayability: 8ENJOYMENT: 7FRUSTRATION: 8Follow me on Twitter: @nickygra97Subscribe to my channelLike on Facebook{LINK REMOVED}Check my official websiteJoin my Steam group

												Another great example what is wrong with the current Games Industry. Apart from the poorly performance of this port (hey we give you a game with your graphic card, that you cant run), it hurts me almost physical how aggresively the DLC politic is shoved down our throats. "Season pass here, pre order bonus there. Join our useless portal to get exclusive stuff." its like you have to visit the grandma who cant stands you and feeds you with all stuff of bad candy. It just feels wrong in every way. And dont let me start on the first impression I got from the stuff I saw so far in game. I mean, I loved the 2 other Arkham games from Rocksteady, but it just seems, like they run out of ideas and said "f*ck it, lets put the Batmobile into it". Yeah a lot of people want to drive that massive vihicle, but there is a huge different in "wanting" and "have to". Apart from that, the controls of the Dark Knights biggest toy, feels sluggish. But to be fair, that is just a first impression, maybe its something I can get used to. Oh and the graphical options are a freaking joke, like only the Clown of Crime could pull off. Most options can only be changed after restarting the game. The description of the different options are as transparent as a brick wall. Anti Alliasing = Yes - No...Really? Maybe, just maybe this will all be fixed, after a glorious Patch-Festival, but for now, dont buy that thing. In fact, that dlc policy that WB pulls of, only justifies a heavely discounted all in one version. I'm sorry for rocksteady, but that game seems way to rushed by the publisher. WB should look at another company with 2 big letters, because they are about to go down the same path.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2015
												If you enjoyed Origins, you'll likely enjoy this. It's quite a play it safe sequel in terms of new features and story. Story constantly teases the whole "how far will Batman go? Will he break this time?”. Story to me is a bit of a let-down, the trailers made it out to be that all these major villains are joining forces to kill Batman, when in reality it's just Scarecrow and Arkham knight, with the other villains just being side missions...quite repetitive ones at that. There is no sense of danger throughout the game, yes Scarecrow is threatening to blow up a chemical bomb, yes Arkham Knight has a whole militia in Gotham...but there is no one in Gotham....just a few thugs going for a joy ride. At least in City you felt some sense of urgency with Batman's declining health and the countdown to protocol 10, you had this feeling that you have to win against the odds. In this game, none of that.Gameplay wise, I can't complain, everything to love about the Arkham games is here and improved. More enemy types, more gadgets, better adaptive AI. It's fine, although a tad easy at times. You can take a lot of punishment, to a point stealth is pointless in some predator areas....not all but some. Batmobile is....meh? It's cool to drive around and how it moves around the city is pretty cool, you feel like you are in some badass tank/sports car. How it's used in the game? Some of the puzzle sections are quite fun and do require thought but part of me wished there was a bit less of it. Towards the end of the game it felt like a chore. My main complaint of gameplay are the damn tank battles...why? So many tedious tank battles...I haven't felt this bored from a side activity since the tower defence in assassin's creed revelations. Again, it's fine early on, but after a while they don't up the difficulty they just make you fight hordes of tanks to a point it’s just mashing the fire button while sliding left and right. Haven't mentioned anything about the PC port being god awful....It's embarrassing that a AAA title which was released back in June is stilling being patched. The game was playable enough for me to get what I wanted from it...which wasn't much. Regardless, it’s pitiful and no excuse can be made for releasing a game in the condition it was in. Once it’s patched up and fixed, I would say it’s an ok game. Better than Origins, not as good as the first two games. If you want more Batman, get it. The open world is fun and at times you do feel like batman, just feels like there was a lot more to be desired, or maybe they probably squeezed all they could out of the franchise. Just a shame it ended the way it did for PC gamers, even when they fix this game, to me it will always be known as that ok Batman game which was a terrible port. It’s like a big fart.6/10-For all you number people

content:
Posted: May 21, 2016
												When Arkham Knight was announced I knew I needed to play it, so to wait for it, I started to play the 3 previous games.I migrated to PC gaming recently from consoles, so they were the first games I played on PC, the experience was awesome, graphics were amazing, history was incredible, I simple just love them.I bought Arkham Knight right after its release, but I was still playing Arkham City at that time and I still needed to play Arkham Origins, also at that time the complains about performance started and the game was temporally removed from Steam. I didn't asked for a refund since I really wanted to play it whenever it would be available again, so I just waited.When I finished Arkham Origins I was ready to start with Arkham Knight, at that time it came back to Steam and most performance issues were fixed, I'm not going to lie you, I spend some time trying to configure the video settings to get the best performance/quality, and I did it, my PC is an Alienware Alpha which has a GeForce GTX 860M graphics card with 2GB of GDDR5, it is not too big but worked for me. I was able to play and enjoy this game a lot.So now that I talked about the performance experience, I want to talk about my experience with the story of the game.For some reason in these games you really feel you are Batman, the missions and information got your attention, there are details everywhere and it doesn't feel repetitive like other open-world games. The introduction of the batmobile feels weird at the beginning, but you get familiar with it quickly, sometimes you really wish to have it right next to you. Personally I prefer the enemies that represent mystic, dark or powerful characters over the enemies that are just mobs or militia, which were the main characters on this game, thinking about this detail, I believe Arkham City was better, but for the rest, I think Arkham Knight is offering a great improvement, it is good to learn about all the Batman family story and work with all of them. I really recommend it because I loved it. Performance issues are fixed and this game is playable now, don't worry about it.PD: The batsuit in this game is the best suit I have ever seen in Batman movies or games, I really wanted this suit for Batman v Superman, but anyway...

content:
Posted: October 28, 2015
												===2nd UPDATE===Here is a couple things that need to be mentioned first. 4 Months ago Batman Arkham Knight was pulled of Steam, at the time before the first miniature patch I was able to play this game fine at locked 30 fps and it was smooth due to community fixes. We all know who that is and he has done more work than entire Rocksteady and WB combined. So 4 months have past and the interim patch broke my game much worse than the previous patch. So it was even more broken, once again I was forced to use community patches done by community and not WB and Rocksteady. Then today comes and I am expecting to play DLC's. As you can see from my playtime I already pushed over 100Hrs into this game. Well guess what, I have troubleshooted multiple times and yet to recieve all said DLC supposed to be released today. I was expecting to be able to play DLC's but that is not the case. From what I read on Forums the Season Pass holders have some serious issues and have been pretty much scandaled. Now Pros-Game runs decent if you lower your settings and not overdo things. Gameworks look good. -Story was very well done and even the Riddler challenges were decent.-When game ran smoothly on launch for me game mechanics were amazing and fluid.-Lots of funny references and well done comedy. -Unexcepted Ending though depends what you think is good.Cons-Rain textures still buggy, Only work every once in while.-Gamework options are horrible for performance and should not even be touched or turned on period-Game runs worse then launch day.-SLI is still not fixed for those with said setup-Villian claimed to be original isn't at all but a lie. Die Hard Fans Know him very well-WB support is horrendious-Apparently game now needs 12GB of RAM on Win 10. This is not realistic at all.-DLC Content not fully released to Season Pass Holders-Compensation done by WB is worthless if a diehard fan. If you own the games then your out of luck.-Promises still being broken and patch notes released are not even patch notes but a joke.All said and done I would not recomment this game to anyone and if you have a console then get it for that instead. PC right now has been treated poorly and WB has done nothing but lie through their teeth. Many Claims made and promises broken. Releasing the game with no performance gains is unacceptable. Many have claimed performance has yet to change.===New Information===After almost 6 hours DLC content is now downloading and can't wait to play said DLC's. Though I hear that for some game is even more broken now with DLC's installed so I am crossing my fingers hoping I do not fall into that category. Though even with DLC's finally being released finally I still would not recommend buying this game for PC. Get it for Console since it works marvelously on that since the PC community was not a priority.I will state though the story is fantastic and a masterpiece but sadly ruined by many of the game issues that plague this version. You can get the game running much better but you have to go really far out of your way to get the fixes and at least doable.===Additional Update===After playing the game after its re-release I will say the game still needs massive fixes.Without using 3rd party help from specific topics in Batman Arkham Knight forum this game would still be heavily unplayable for many. Though WB recently announced that until the end of 2015 refunds through steam and only purchased through steam are available to get full refund without worry of your playtime. I have obtained my refund and is still pending but time will only tell if the game gets any more serious fixes. On top of that WB also mentioned that they will speak to the community about things that apparently can not be fixed in the game. Reason why I got my refund. This is a warning flag in my mind and so be wary of this title. Tried playing the DLC's but some like the Red Hood DLC kept crashing and I felt there was no story with that DLC. Just mostly you fighting a bunch of enemies and majority of the Vehicle skins can only be used in racing which is a shame.

content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
												I think it's important to contribute a review that doesn't just focus on the technical issues. I bought it recently and have played about 20 hours. I haven't had a single glitch in that time. Follow the recommended specs, and you should be fine.For the game itself, it's both good and bad. I still like Asylum the best of the series. I think it was actually the right size in terms of gameplay with a good progression overall to both main and side quests. This game is enormous, and it's really not always in a good way.First, the good:The Batmobile is pretty awesome. I was genuinely surprised. I thought it would by clunky and pointless like most attempts to add vehicles into established series are, but it actually plays really well. I think the chase side missions involving the batmobile are some of the most fun in the game. The pseudo-destruction reaped upon the city as you mow down statues and cleave off corners of walls adds to the feeling that you're driving an incredibly powerful machine. Mowing down an entire riot of baddies sending them flying in all directions is also entertaining. It's over-powered, but the game compensates for that by locking off encounters that should be fought without it.The new types of side missions are also cool. I like the addition of the flying drones, and the takedown method for them is clever. The different types of bad guys are managed well, and there are lots of creative opportunities for playing around with your abilities.The Mediocre:The story has its good points, but a lot of it is really melodramatic and predictable. Harley Quinn's voice is the single most annoying thing ever created. Picture everything she says as voiced by Jar Jar for added entertainment value. The way The Joker is handled is a lot of fun. I think that's the most entertaining part of the story. The part that's trying to be a Nolan movie just fell on its face for me. Yea, I get it already. Joker/Batman represent an ethical duality where they're both really two sides of the same coin. They exist outside the law pursuing their own view of the world at the expense of society based solely on their own beliefs. Blah blah blah. Please stop beating me over the head with it like it's not a simple, well-trodden idea. It works really well when they treat it as satire. The Joker has some great moments openly mocking you or egging you on. A number of times I wished I could actually choose to do what he suggested. That would've made a much better game in my opinion. There's also some good chatter of the generic bad guys commenting on elements of the world or just their own generic nature. When it tries to take itself seriously, it becomes dull in its trauma.The Bad:This game is huge. This seems like a weird thing to cite as bad, but it's so absurdly large that it becomes genuinely aggravating. The side quests are the biggest example. There's an entire wheel of side quests. I'm not sure how many there are exactly, but I'd estimate around 20. They're not just go somewhere, do the thing, and finish the quest type of deals. You go do the thing, and then five more of that thing appear an hour later. So you go do those five, but then still five more appear another hour later. After fifteen to twenty-five of them, you might finally be done. That's the case for nearly every single one of the twenty different side quests. Some things aren't even official side quests but still need to be eliminated anyway like the aerial drones.So you clear out a sector of the map. Then you progress in the story a little, and all of a sudden that sector isn't clear anymore. It's not filled with something new and cool though. It just has a few more of exactly the same time-consuming thing you already cleared out the first time. It's fun clearing out the aerial drones the first 5-8 times. When they start appearing four more at a time in the late game, it's just painful. The checkpoints would also be fun just a few times, but there are like 40 of them to clear out. Many of the side quests are really just the same thing in a "different situation." Rescuing firefighters, clearing military checkpoints, and clearing out watchtowers all involve taking out exactly the same clustered group of baddies in basically the same way. You're just doing it for a supposedly different goal. Every single one of those will have to be done so many times to fulfill their own quests that you'll have no desire to finish them. My hat is off to anyone who has 100% this game. That's a Sisyphean task to me.It goes further. There are 243 riddler puzzles. I kid you not. I'm actually bored just by the idea of going after them all. It's obvious someone just went through the map after they finished this massive city and stuck a trophy in every single place you could possibly fit one. It's obnoxious. All of this goes against basic game design principles. Have a clear and varied progression that increases in challenge. Most of the content in this game is the same thing over and over. The unfortunate part of that is it really takes away from the parts of the game that are well-designed and do present a varied challenge. I understand they were trying to make a huge epic conclusion, but they really cluttered it up and made it shallow by throwing in too much of the same kinds of content.Synopsis:Overall I recommend it. I paid about $13 for it on sale, and I think I got more than enough good content for my money. I'd pay up to $20 for it. Pay the price tag if you really love the series and know you can run it. The story isn't bad and does have both fun and cool moments. The batmobile is awesome to play with, and the city is fun to fly around sporadically wrecking baddies. Explore the more varied content until you feel like you've seen everything you want to, and then quit. Much of the extra content and side quests quickly become overly similar and boring. Don't plan to 100% the game. For reference, I did 100% Asylum and loved it. I wouldn't recommend even trying to 50% this one in terms of completing all side quests and clearing all sectors. It's not a fun task. Play through the main story and explore, and you'll have a good time with it. I'd say 7/10 for a rating.

number of helpful: 32 of 47 people (68%) found this review helpful54 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												Batmobile™: Arkham Knight is the finale of Rocksteady's Batman series. The original title of this game was deliberately misleading in order to surprise fans when they discover the true protagonist of this game, the Batmobile. Drive around the stunningly beautiful Gotham City and take in the sights at a smooth 20FPS, all while blowing up unmanned APCs and blasting unarmed men with your taser. The gameplay is a mix between Twisted Metal and Burnout, you chase down cars, blast them with your cannons, then drive up walls. Gotham City has become so lawless even the laws of physics no longer apply. Team up with old foes and release plant spores all over the city, because your frame rate wasn't tanking hard enough. Unfortunately the good also comes with the bad. Just when you thought you were free from the universally reviled fighting segments from the previous games, you get kicked out of the Batmobile occasionally and have to control Batman. Fight through waves of mindless goons and throw a few batarangs so you can progress to the next driving segment. On the bright side, the dreaded challenge maps from the previous games were removed and were instead replaced by racecourses so you can drive your cool car around some more. The story contains the greatest twist out of all the Arkham games. You learn that Batman, the world's greatest detective, is unfathomably stupid. Watch as he discovers the blinking bomb shaped device in the road happens to actually be a bomb, and be drawn to the edge of your seat with anticipation as Batman tries to identify who the Arkham Knight is, because you probably figured it out immediately. Overall I'd recommend this game to driving game enthusiasts everywhere and fans of Harley Quinn's massive assHOLYSHIT.I know you've all looked, you can't lie to me.

I literally NEVER preorder games, but for Arkham Knight, I decided to, considering the series solid track record of PC ports. I own and have played all 3 previous games in the series, and they all ran beautifully on my set up (hd7970, intel i7). It's sad to see a series I have played and loved on the PC end like this. Do yourself a favor, do not purchase this game. From what I've read, the ps4 version runs at a near perfect 30 FPS, that's your next best bet if you wish to play this game at a reasopnable framerate.

content:
Posted: October 28, 2015
												It still doesn't work well.Here's the story of Batman AK: it released as one of the worst PC ports of all time, if not THE worst one. WB tried to scam PC users by giving us a poorly ported, buggy, unplayable mess and the whole thing blew up in their faces.So what did they do? They removed the game from sale, of course, and promised they wouldn't put it back on sale until they managed to fix all the issues it had. It took them four months to do this.So, what changed during those four months? Here's a list:- Nothing.- Nothing.- A bunch of Season Pass content is coming soon for PC, but it doesn't matter since it's made up of either new suits that add no gameplay or 15 minute "stories".- Nothing.- Nothing.- The game still stutters like hell, making it more difficult than it should be, particularly when riding on the BatGimmick.- Nothing.- WB attempted to give fans who didn't get a refund or who buy the rerelease immediately a compensation in the form of the old Batman games. You know, the ones that anyone who gets AK already has.- Nothing.So, all in all, the game you're getting today is still the same mess it was four months ago. It seems they just spent four months twiddling their thumbs at the office and hoped to rerelease later, after the scandal had passed, with nary a change to the game.And the thing is, even if the game ran perfectly (It doesn't, not at all, it runs terribly) it STILL isn't a great game. It's not worth $50 or $60. It's a rehash of the previous Batman games that looks pretty but plays poorly, has an uninteresting storyline and has a batmobile tacked on as a gimmick that just won't go away and you can't get rid of because it's essential to the gameplay.So considering the terrible state the game is STILL on and the fact that even ignoring all optimization issues the game just isn't great and the season pass is a scam I can't possibly recommend this. If you're hurting for action games just get The Witcher 3 or Fallout 4. Wait a few years until maybe this thing has been fixed or it's in the bargain bin. It's well worth $5, but not even close to being worth $50.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												Hate to kick a game when it's down, but this PC port is seriously bad.I seem to be able to run better than most.  If I leave the game locked at 30fps, the game is "playable".  No massive hangs or anything, but there's still lots of terrible textures and low-detail models being used when the game can't stream in the better quality stuff on time.  Frame rate drops to low 20s every so often.  Motion Blur seems to add a slight delay, leading to everything feeling sluggish...  5.1 Surround audio is ignored for some voices, but not others, which is very disorienting.  etc etc etcAll you need to know is it's one of the worst PC ports I've ever seen, and unless there's some miracles coming, I don't know how even half a dozen patches gets to this to acceptable levels.  I really hope this game is playable some day, but I'm not holding my breath.  Save your money.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												Buy new graphics card( EVGA 980 ti SC). Install graphics card. Play games at max settings at 60 fps give or take a few. Nvidia is nice enough to give me a free game to test out my new card. Pre load game yesterday. Can't wait because I love this series.  Load the graphics settings. First thing I do is turn v-sync off. Then look at how little settings there are to change. Turn everything up to max and run pc diagnostic test . Runs from 61 fps to 156 fps through testing. Play game. I notice my frames cannot go above 30. I make sure I turned v sync off. Yep, it was off. Contemplated in my head that they actually caped a PC game.... Hour goes by and game crashes. Reload game and storm knocks my power out...... Turn PC back on and run game. still 30 fps. go to reviews and sure enough it was locked. Damn consoles.  Edit file to uncap the fps. 0/10 would not want to do a work around again. U wot Rocksteady?PS: Game runs ok, not great. Fps can dip to 30 fps in some areas. The game has crased five times on me, all being during a riddilers challenge. I like the main story so far. The side quests seem meaningless for the most part.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												To be honest, this game is so ♥♥♥♥ing worth it. I bought it a while ago before all of the patches and bug fixes and it sucked then. Keyword "then". Now, this game runs very well (at the time i was running a GTX 970 paired with a fx 6300 and 16gb of memory.) and doesnt seem to have any of the issues that have made its launch so rocky and controversal.Story:Single player is amazing, there is so much replayablitily and missions to complete (maybe a little too much). Lots of hours to sink into this game. The campaign/story always kept me on my toes wanting more. I would start playing at like 3pm and i would not realize that it was already 1 in the morning by the time i am done.Character development is on point, with great voice acting and story telling. It is everything that a true batman fan would want.Graphics:OMG the graphics are amazing, and now that i have a gtx 1080 and a i7 6700k i can crank the settings up to ultra and see the amazing artwork that was put into this game. The attention to detail is great.Controls:Great xbox, ps4 (any controller really) support. Usually with games like this i sit back and pull out my xbox controller and play. I cant give an honest review about the controls for mouse and keyboard, but you can always remap your keybindings.Combat system:Uh its a batman game. Its freaking great. Not as good as Batman Arkham origins but pretty good (Arkham origins was probably the best one of the series).Performance:The performance is really great now. At launch, the game had terrible opimization and was not primarly focused for the PC market. Now after many updates, patch fixes and free content i have to say the game runs very well. Even with my AMD fx 6300 (oc'd to 4.9 ghz on water) it was a complete bottleneck to my gtx 970. Once i installed the i7, i realized the true performance of my 970. This proves however that this game does not utlize multiple cores and really depends on good single core performance.SO SHOULD I BUY IT?:In short, yes...Why? Because its a great game that has really ressurected itself from the ashes that it created at launch. But now this game is kick♥♥♥♥♥with some of the best, most fluid combat ever.

number of helpful: 19 of 24 people (79%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 6, 2016
												So, if you're still on the fence about buying Arkham Knight, get down and do it. It had a very rocky start, the game was barely playable for the first several months. However, after lots of patches the performance was finally fixed, and now it's clear that performance was its only downside. Batman: Arkham Knight is the Batman we fell in love with back in Arkham Asylum: epic, eye-catching and just plain cool.What's good:+ Proper epic story with lots of great villains and anti-heroes, proper Batman, proper Gotham again under a proper threat. I honestly believe that story is the game's strongest point. At times it's as intense as Nolan's Dark Knight movies.+ Amazing performance after patch (I get over 70 FPS with GTX 970)+ FIGHTS! AK has even more developed and dare I say hardcore combat system+ BATMOBILE! Not on is it cool by itself, but the outside and inside gameplay are practically seamlessly connected+ Lots of Batmobile-specific features, goals and fights, it's not just for show+ LOTS of challenges and DLC mini-stories+ LOTS of skins for the Batman and the Batmobile+ Joker is here and as cool as ever+ Thrilling game introNot so good:- IMO the main villain is one-dimensional, boring and whiny (thank god he's not the only one)- Alternative characters are available only in ministories; no free-roaming with Catwoman this time :(- As cool as other playable characters are, their fighting style is too similar to Batman's- Lots of pointless DLCs (like 1-skin DLCs), which I believe are a cancer of modern gaming and shouldn't exist- Even non-cancerous DLC content is rather short- Following in Assassin's Creed footsteps, Batman requires destroying enemy outposts, towers and droids that the main villan put over the whole city (to be honest, it's still a thousand times more interesting than towers and outposts in any Ubisoft game, and the types of these fortifications are rather varied, but still)- Batman's ability to not kill anybody is getting ridiculous. Not only he's strong as hell, he can also run knocked-out people over with the Batmobile (which is equipped with a machine gun and a rocket launcher, by the way), and the car is also capable of knocking them away with powerful electric blastsTo sum up, one of the best action games I've played and probably the best Batman game as of now.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2015
												To be perfectly clear, I love this game, I think it is a fantastic game and it is one of my new favorite games, but you can't deny the fact that this game is a♥♥♥♥♥♥poor PC port.This game represents everything wrong with PC development. Let me make a list of everything wrong with this game.-Locked 30 FPS-Lack of graphical options-Horrible performance and frame drops-Graphic glitches (texture bugs/artifacts)-Constant crashes-Small, inexperienced team ported the game (12 people developed this PC port)So the game is locked at 30 FPS, and can easily be unlocked in a config file, but is cleary locked considering at anything above 30 fps you get constant FPS drops and it becomes an unplayable stuttery mess. I have a mid-range system too, nothing too high-end, but I should be able to mange 60 FPS at the lowest settings at 720p (Core i5 4690k, R9 270, 8gb Ram) but nope, at 720p low settings, I do sometimes get 60 FPS, but if I even move I drop to 40-30 FPS, and it becomes hard to do, anything really. It is VERY noticable while driving too, and it just becomes a headache. There are also only 3 standard graphic options (leaving out gameworks ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t), texture quality, which only has 2 settings, low and normal, shadow quality, which is low-high, and Level of Detail, which is also low to high. This is unacceptable and needs to be fixed. This game shows EVERYTHING that is wrong with modern PC ports and this needs to change. As stated before, this is one of my new favorite games, but when it comes down to it, this is just an unacceptable port.*Edit: Will update after a patch is released for a more "proper" review of the game.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2015
												Half way through August and still no fix, don't support this behaviour. I kept the game in faith that WB would put all resources into fixing this terrible terrible port, gave them more benefit of the doubt than they had earned but it seems they are content to take the nock and keep 3/4 of their resources firmly on producing more DLC.And if that's not true and most of the stuido are on this project then that just speaks to how much of a terrible product they tried to offload on us in the first place.But they know people will make excuses for them and we all have short memories. WB and Rocksteady (to a lesser extent granted) need to understand gaming culture is changing, they make A LOT of money from us and it's about time we started to band together as consumers and demand better quality from so called triple A products.I have cancelled my preorder of Mad Max and I'd urge you all to do the same - because what incentive do they have to QA a game that's already slipped deadlines, that they're trying to rush to market if they already have your money and you're content to give them an extra 2 months development time after you've already paid? Simply cannot support a publisher that treats the consumer base with such disregard.I'd like to add that of my 13.8 hours on record I've only progressed as far as the second island, the rest of the time has been spent trying various fixes, hardware set up's and ini tweaks.All to no avail as I still get frequent stutters, pauses and crashes.In this time I've upgraded my Graphics card (which works immaculately in every other new game in my library) I've updated to windows 10 and I've added another 8gb or RAM to see if the issue was the rediculous memory leak.Nothing. Can't even get a smooth experience at 30fps 1080p on a gtx980ti with a devils canyon I5 @ 4.7 and 16gb 2100 RAM on a samsung EVO SSD.For reference I play the witcher 3 at 1440p with everything on max except hairworks AA (on high) and foliage distance (high) @ mostly 70+fps.

number of helpful: 16 of 19 people (84%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												What a astounding♥♥♥♥♥♥up this game has been. WB release broken game. Hideously broken. Unplayable for most users. They released it KNOWING this. Huge public outcry, so they pull game from shelves. They then sit virtually incommunicado for 4 months and release a patch that actually makes it WORSE fro some users. More silence. Two months later they put it back on sale after another patch, recommend that you have a MINIMUM 12 GB of RAM to run the game, release DLC they charge a fortune for despite it being uniformly crap, and offer as recompense free copies of the other Arkham games which 90% of purchasers already own. I bought the season pass. I didn't get a refund, thinking (wrongly) that users would have the right thing done by them. I already own EVERY Arkham game, so for my patience and loyalty I get absolutely NOTHING. The behaviour of WB has been nothing short of disgusting. On these reasons alone I do not recommend you buy this or any other WB/Rocksteady game EVER. Play them if you like (and I'm sure you know how to arrange this) but do not give them your money. They simply do not deserve it.As for the game itself...aside from the stuttering cutscenes, the way the dialogue that can't quite keep up with the graphics, and the frame drops (and I'm running a system with 32GB RAM and twin 4GB cards but dual cards areen't supported lol) and the tearing, and all the extra NVIDEA effects that cripple frame rate....it's ok. The timing on the combat seems out but you get used to it, the batmobile is cool enough but overused (oh and you can't use the DLC skins for it in game, only in the stupid "races" which are just obstacle courses). The map is huge but a lot of it doesn't have much to do in it, aside from speeding past it in the batmobile. The story is ok, The gadgets are ok. The DLC is terrible - you can't even use all the costumes in game except in the AR challenges. Some of the new enemy types - medics, those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s with drones - are a nice addition.As for the mystery of the Arkham Knight? Took me 5 minutes to get it right. Ho hum.  Is it anywhere as near as good as Asylum or City? No. If you want a good Batman game buy those. If you already own those get Shadow of Mordor (which is excellent just don't waste your time on the DLC) - the gameplay is essentially the same with a fantasy twist, you actually have to THINK to take down Captains,  the story is great and the Nemesis system adds a brillaint new mechanic. If Arkham Knight was super cheap - under $10 - and you have 12GB of RAM - MAYBE. But frankly just don't give your money to WB, and play something else - there's a ton of far more deserving games and publishers out there. Buy Phantom Pain or ARmello or that Rocket soccer car game everyone seems to like. Hell give the money to a homeless guy or your favorite charity. Flush it down the toilet. Buy some meth. Whatever floats your boat. Just don't give a publisher that thinks treating customers like♥♥♥♥♥♥is ok any of your hard earned cash. Vote with your wallets, it's the only way they will learn. And Warner Bros. ♥♥♥♥ YOU. You're on the List.

												Barring all the performance issues (of which there are many), this is a horribly mediocre way of ending what was once a fantastic series. number of helpful: 12 of 12 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												LIVE REVIEW!I'll be adding as I go on.  Let's get started:HOUR 1Game crashes on first launch, which is only fair as I seemed to be one of the few souls who got to play all 3 previous installments with zero technical issues.  Second time works, so I set about tweaking settings since my GTX 760 is not going to be able to handle this game on max.  Unfortunately, as messing around with these settings requires several restarts, this quickly becomes tedious as the game sticks diligently to its setting of launching succesfully 50% of the time.Additionally, Geforce Experience seems to be on the fritz, so I decide to reboot the PC.  Nope, Geforce hates me too, so it's to time to uninstall him.  While waiting the mandated 20 minutes for that to happen, I go hunting for a fresh copy online, and with so much time on my hands, hit the forums for some light reading, upon which I learn that Geforce seems to not be doing so well in the customer satisfaction index side of things.  Thinking quickly, I decide to forego a software install and opt for just the drivers.  Whew, that was close!Google Chrome tells me that should be done in 2 hours (thanks to the ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥♥mongering ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ dickless wondercunts at the DSL company).  I tried launching the game anyway, but the failure rate has rocketed up the charts, like a boy band single, to 100% currently.  I'm going to validate the files then see how many times I can launch the game while the driver downloadsHOUR 2Well, the validation seems to have helped, but even with all the graphic settings turned down low, the game is still stuttering a lot, particularly with the driving, and the low-res textures are quite nasty, especially the outdoor thugs who are supposed to be wet from the rain and instead look like they're covered in tha goop from the pods in the Matrix.  Having said the Batmobile is hella cool and I can see how gorgeous this game would be if I wasn't trying to run it on a potato. Last but certainly not least, playing as batman himself feels like slipping on your favourite jacket.One thing that surprised me is that with the bigger map and bigger streets, this is the first game in the series where I'm happy to just sometimes wander the streets on foot instead of zipping about with the batclaw or just sticking to the Batmobile.  The city feels a lot more real than the compact Arkham City and the semi-fake one from Arkham Origins.  I can't wait to explore.  time for some dinner, then a driver install, and we'll see what's what.More to come...

number of helpful: 12 of 12 people (100%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
												As it stands now, just days after release, this is by far the most horribly ported Batman game ever released by Rocksteady and WB. From an unknown studio that handled the port to being absolutely crippling on a full AMD rig this game is a lackluster ending to a well received and fantastic series.I'll be honest, I've gotten no more than 10 minutes into the actual game at this point as it completely cripples my rig. Running a top of the line AMD system with dual Sapphire Tri-X R9 290s in Xfire I get no better than 20fps, tops. FPS range from 0-20, at tops, and the gameplay is the most fantastic slideshow you've never seen. An 8GB patch 2 days after release did nothing to improve performance. Needless to say, this supposedly fantastic Batman game will be sitting in my Steam library awaiting further patching. If you're running an all AMD rig, be very, very hesitant upon purchasing this game. Besides most of the AMD users unable to run the game it seems as even high end GPU users from Nvidia are even having problems. Folks running dual 900 series are getting the same slideshow as me. Anyway. Unless about 2 months have past I'd save my money and invest in something else if possible.EDIT: November 9th, 2015So, the game has been "out" on pc since the end of June this year, then was taken off Steam completely because it was so bjorked and now has been back for, I"m guessing, about a month almost now. So, since I had absolutely no luck with previously trying to get the game to run back in June I figured I'd try one last time. My previous try cost me an hour and a half of my life wasted on this game trying EVERYTHING to get it to work in some capacity. As you read prior, I had NO luck. None whatsoever.    I am happy to tell you that at this time the game seems to run pretty damn well now. It took 4-5 months and some HUGE patches but on an ALL AMD rig it seems to be working really, really good. My specs are in my Profile and have not changed except for the AMD driver #. I ran it using the AMD driver 15.7.1 and the game kept telling me my driver was out of date. It wasn't. It IS the current driver for most AMD GPUs. I did, however, switch over to the newer beta driver 15.11 and the messages stopped and the game actually seemed to run somewhat even better.    This is by no means a FULL review of this game. It's a trial and error "report", so to speak. However, I don't think my actual "thumbs up, thumbs down" review will change. WB stumbled way to long, delivered an extremely shoddy product and in return for PC users trouble "gave" us what DLC was available to console owners up to the patch. For an "epic" Batman finale we PC users deserved a better product for what we paid. I will give kudos to where kudos are due and WB and Rocksteady bent over backwards trying to "fix" the game. The unfortunate after-shock of all of this is the game is still very unplayable for a LOT of people. I will say this in fairness. I ended up buying the PS4 version because I was so disgusted with the PC product. With WB making refunds applicable til the end of the year, regardless of time spent, I'm guessing I'll be going that avenue and seeking recompensation for this purchase after I spend another couple of hours "fooling" around and testing the game further. If it exceeds my expectations, who knows? Maybe I'll actually just trade my PS4 version instead.

												Pros+Amazing puzzle+Smooth combat, one of the best game combat so far imo+Stunning visual, no matter you set the graphic to low or high, it would still stunning+Great batmobile handling+A lot of mission variation (MAIN MISSION)+Well designed gotham map+Pretty good story+Lot of outfits+Worth price+Joker existence as illussion in batman mind is just made this game felt so awesome.Cons-Overused batmobile, seriously if only they just made 2-4 batmobile mission it would be better-Repetitive side mission, but too annoying if we not complete it, military things almost ruin the game-You have to complete every damn side mission to unlock "actuall ending"? My God it's fine if there's a lot of variation, interesting story, creative mission design that motivate us in side mission but cleaning up tanks with batmobile multiple times+collect every single riddler trophy? Nope nope nope-There's a boss fight in every side mission if you had completed it, it suppossed to be an epic fight but really? It's highly ruined because you just do the same thing like normal side mission, just with higher difficulty, not for all side mission but for some, it is. there are some variation in some side mission ending like pyg's, riddler's, azrael's, but rest of it really really sucks. The worst part? There's a side mission that u have to confront deathstroke at the end, i was thinking about fighting deathstroke like in arkham origin and it suppossed to be epic, but, once again, batmobile ruin it, you have to fight him in tank battle.Just buy it if you love arkham series, have decent PC, didn't mind about insanely repetitive side mission

number of helpful: 14 of 16 people (88%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												An Open Letter To WB Interactive Entertainment:You sons of ♥♥♥♥♥s,The community waited three years for this, some even spending money for the phoned-in, hollow, shitmuck cash-grab of Arkham Origins to prove to you that this third game was something fans wanted. Something we would wait for. Something we trusted Rocksteady to deliver on. How did you choose to reward this show of faith? By carving Rocksteady's final love letter to a beloved character and franchise into bite-size DLC and mandating the Playstation 4 be the lead platform for development. You gibbering, mouth-breathing,♥♥♥♥♥♥filled♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Your inept meddling in the creation of what could have been one of the most well-recieved, well-reviewed, and fondly remembered gaming series of the last decade has caused it to be little more than a raspy death rattle in lamentation of what could have been. ♥♥♥♥.Some would call it irony that all of your ill-advised decisions to "maximize product ROI" has led to such a costly and, frankly, embarrassing public relations nightmare; rushing a product so obviously far from completion onto market and emphasizing day-one purchases by surgically excising all the notes and chords of the experience and offering them as pre-purchase incentives has earned you nothing but scorn and derision from anyone with a voice.Your corporate ineptitude, short-sightedness, and complete failure to understand the very market you seek to monetize has done you no favors and, most reprehensibly of all, has damaged Rocksteady's reputation, leaving the young company with a black mark that will not fade for years. They are the Arkham studio, and where once that association brought acclaim and praise, it is now met with muted applause, the low of this final act still burning raw in public memory.WB Interactive, you have failed. You'll point to console units shipped and worldwide sales totals as a counterpoint, but you know full well the truth. You won't be shocked as you hear your name spoken with barely-concealed scorn at trade shows. You'll be hurt, not insulted, that studios grow cold to your embrace. You'll understand that the bewildering, naive choices you made in handling such a beloved franchise will have chilling effects lasting years. You turned a profit this quarter, now pray for the next.

I think we all know that.But it's gotten a lot of work since then.It's not perfect - I've had a total of 4 crashes (all while gliding in the air, oddly), the Batmobile controls could use some fine-tuning, camera glitches and zooms weirdly when flying the Remote Batarang through vents, performance isn't great, and some of the Riddler challenges are frustrating as heck - but it's still worth buying. Having just gotten 100% completion (First time I ever did that in an Arkham game), I can say that this is a worthy entry in the series.  Better than Arkham City for sure, probably better than the others as well. Gameplay is great, the graphics are absolutely gorgeous, the story and writing are as excellent as ever, and it's overall absolutely worth the price of admission. I finished it a few hours ago and I'm still grinning.If you were scared off by the fiasco of the original launch, give it another try.

number of helpful: 36 of 56 people (64%) found this review helpful7 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												First of all, there's a 30 FPS cap, that's bad... You can easily fix it with a quick googe search, so it's good now, right? Kinda... Not really...The game is not well optimized, we need some stutter fix. When i just spin the camera i drop from everything between from 68 to 21 FPS. Super annoying when i'm gliding, as it can drop to even 1 FPS. I even used the performance test in the game and got solid 48+ FPS atleast, it looked smooth and quite sexy. Not what i get in the game though, it's not as sexy. :/As long as it is like this, i do not want to recommend it. But atleast in the little sequence where i got into a fight, it was good, it felt like Batman combat, smooth 40 FPS, hehe...EDIT:Other than that let's review the rest of the game.As of now i've gotten a bit more play time, so i'll break down somme of the elements in the game.Combat:I love it. The basic combat is easy and satisfying, it looks smooth and cool and you just land a sick punch after another. There are some more advanced combat, where you can sneak upon enemies and take them down easily in a chain from 3 to 5, a mechanic that makes it easier to take down armed enemies and it's a reward for stelathing.The Batmobile:It looks amazing, it's such a massive tool and has a beautiful design. The driving however, feels too heavy, it feels like you're driving a boosted tank, steering it is kinda weird, but powersliding works fine. There is however a combat mechanic in the batmobile where you kind of control it like a 4-legged sliding robot. This mechanic feels great, really. You can strafe with small boosters and steer through tight spaces easily and your winch to pull down stuff on the map is awesome.Story so far: SPOILERS, maybe?I'm still just in the beginning, but the main villain is Scarecrow(I love Scarecrow) and it's about his new chemical experiment(zombies, kind of?) and so far the interaction and cutscenes are pretty cool. I must say, it gets you in the story fast and keeps going like that as of now.Graphics:This game is beautiful. On High ofcourse. It does look good Low, but you can see the lack of details up close, especially on the batsuit. The rain/weather looks good enough to make a darker atmosphere.But as it is poorly optimized i'm running my game on Low still. Could go High, but too many frame drops in movement.Memory:It's a really RAM heavy game.I have 8Gb of RAM. While playing on Low and no AA. 3 Monitors, no programs other than Steam open. ~85% memory usage. Open Google Chrome, 95-100%. Just a heads up.PS. Will edit as the game gets updates and I get further in the story.

number of helpful: 17 of 22 people (77%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 22, 2016
												Bought it on release day, it ran like crap. Just picked it up in the sale and my god, it's like a whole new game. R9 290, i5-4690K, 8Gb mem, everything maxed except for shadows and it runs between about 45 to 60 FPS with very little stutter, or at least no more than I'm accustomed to from slapdash console ports. Which is to say, infrequent and bearable.Is the game any good though? I don't know, only played about two hours so far. What I do know is..... the combat feels like it has far less weight to it than in the previous games; it feels more fluid, looks far more badass with all the leaping and froing, but it also feels easier somehow and as a result less engaging.The batmobile isn't great. I mean, I play batman games to swoop around above city streets like a giant armoured lunatic, stalking my prey with my ominous cloak flapping meancingly in the wind. I don't play them to drive around, running people over while failing handbrake turns into buildings. If I wanted to do that I'd reinstall GTAV. So, the fact that the button that always used to be detective mode has now been mapped to GET IN THE bloomin' BATVAN on the 360 controller.... yes. This creates comedy. Plus, it drives like an excitable sponge.Gotham looks gorgeous. I'm quite looking forward to finally giving it an explore.Anyway, I'm going to give this a tentative thumbs up. Only because it's Batman, which is bound to be moneys worth, and it now works, and it's on sale. If the batbuggy bugs me out enough through the game I might reconsider, but right now, considering my play time, I see no reason to be churlish.Update:Okay, a couple of more hours in and I can happily say I'm having a blast. The batcart is not winding me up, in fact it feels quite well integrated into the game, the combat is just as much fun, and the story is beginning to suck me in. On this basis, that tentative thumbs up is a definate.

number of helpful: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 14, 2016
												★★★★☆ "Worth your time, give it a bash" PROS:- Huge island which looks simply stunning. Its bustling, detailed and just brilliant.- Value for money, a good long main story with lots of good side missions keeping you busy and spoilt for choice.- Storyline, I love the Arkham games and this one ties it up nicely. Couldn't wait to find out who was the Arkham Knight!- Once again, awesome use of the fighting mechanics (Not dated imo), lots of gadgets and environmental kills.- More difficult, I thought this one was harder and required a thoughtful use of the environment and the gadgets you have to hand.- Batmobile, lots of people found this part of gameplay flat. Whilst it heavy in quantity, I thought it broke gameplay up nicely. Driving feels insane, love destroying things in my path. If you upgrade wisely then you can be a real menace.CONS:- Its no secret this game has struggled with issues. Everyone's had them, whilst I didn't have them as bad, the game was still choppy in places and crashed on a couple of occasions. At the price you can buy this game now, I wouldn't see this as an issue.- Some side missions are longer then they need to be. Why carry out the same process multiple times? Just feels like a ploy to lengthen the game. VERDICT?Well I had immense fun with this game and in my opinion was the most enjoyable since Arkham Asylum which remains my favourite. This game can be bought for less then £5 now in most places...making it an absolute steal!

number of helpful: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 28, 2015
												I love the other games in the Arkham series, and played them with no issues. Frankly I play a ton of games both old and new, and rarely do I find a game to be just totally unplayable on any of my computers. It was a huge disappointment that this game had so many performance issues it was really unplayable to begin with, and even after their couple of patches it is barely playable with low fps in many areas and still some graphical artifacts. If you do somehow manage to get the game running at a decent speed (which requires a better graphics card and more memory than any other game I have come across to even begin to play), then the game itself is okay but has seemed to me to be the weakest in the Arkham series since it ends up centered so much on requiring the batmobile. It is a lot of fun to have a new toy, but you are required to use it so much that it ends up feeling like a racing/tank shooter game half the time. The rest is pretty good and most of the things you liked about the previous games (if you haven't played them, you should) are still in there to some degree. I am sure it will be a great game in 5-10 years when it is patched either officially or unofficially the way it should be and when most people will actually have computers that will run it reliably.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												Well, what to say about this game...The game itself is great, feels and plays much better than previous installments, I had a lot of fun in these 5 hours that I (tryed to) play, even though I didn't like the previous games very much. The story is also very interesting for me, and the mission design is awesome. I gladly recommend the game, even if you're not a fan on the series (like me), but FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, DON'T BUY IT FOR PC. If you have a console, be my guest and have fun. If you don't, then you should probably pass on this game. The port is TERRIBLE. The game barely runs on 30 fps, doesn't matter which graphics options I pick, while for example Witcher 3 runs completely maxed out without issues. The game also has a FPS lock on 30 so unless you edit a game file by hand, you're not going any higher than that. And last but not least, the graphics features are worse than the PS4 version. How the hell is that even possible?TL;DR:Buy for console, it's an awesome game.Don't get it for PC, it's terrible. If you don't have a console, just pass on the game.

number of helpful: 14 of 17 people (82%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												I tried to like this game, I really did. I loved the first two games (Origins was meh), and this one was certainly fun with the BatTank.But damn it Iron Galaxy, this is one of the worst PC Ports in ages, and yes it is a port. In addition to the HORRID graphical glitches, framerate drops and others that have been mentioned by over 4000 reviewers, there's other glaring issues that show that whoever ported this doesn't know what they're doing.You know the control scheme used in the first three games? Yeah that's completely gone now. Instead, takedowns have been relocated to "alt+1" from the usual places on the keyboard, so when you press e to try to take down badguys, you'll go "huh" as the auto-takedown move is now moved to a two step combo that forces you to think about it in the middle of combat.Want to drop down quickly? NOPE. Rocksteady decided to make use of that middle mouse button, and now it's been included in all "ducking into grates" or "dropping from ledges". Worse, trying to execute a drop attack from a ledge makes Batman just jump to the left on his perch if you're on a ledge for some reason.The absolute worst part *SPOILER ALERT* is when you're in the Ace Chemical Plant trying to minimize the bomb's explosion radius. For some stupid reason, the devs thought it'd be fun to make Batman move HIGHLY VOLITILE chemicals in the form of one of the worst forced "mini-game" segments I've ever seen.I'm assuming with a controller you're suppposed to "slowly rotate" the analog stick to try to (and I kid you not) "slowly remove the chemicals while a weird conveniant sensor on top goes from green to red on how much moving is done" to "walking it over to another area" to "repeat proccess but backwards". If at any time the sensor is in the red you have to stop everything because any more movment causes you to explode and you have to do the damn segment ALL over again.It's even worse wiith the mouse because the "control" scheme just shows the mouse, and if you jiggle your mouse back and forth it will most likely be too fast and cause you to EXPLODE. Even trying to rotate the mouse in tiny circles can cause the sensor to go from green to "ZOMG DON'T EXPLODE" last stage red.So overall, this is a pathetic excuse for a PC port, and I don't reccomend getting it until they patch this thing hard.

number of helpful: 10 of 10 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
AVOID.I will update this should the game ever be truly fixed, but it's looking less and less likely.Arkham Knight is a great game, ruined on PC by a terrible port, made almost bearable over the course of several months. However, this is *not* why I'm telling you not to buy this game.I imagined writing this review closer to Christmas, praising the game and giving Rocksteady/WB a verbose metaphorical pat on the back for taking the time to fix it fully. Unfortunately, the developers (or more likely, the publishers) have recently decided to forgo bringing the port up to par.Temperamental shader and texture glitches have been present and untouched since June. We will never have multiGPU support, and, more importantly, the game's horrible memory allocation - a side effect of heavy optimization compromises made for consoles - is never going to be improved.Arkham Asylum, City and Origins are all great PC games which will be enjoyed for years to come. They're classics.As it stands, Arkham Knight is still a mess. I'm not sure how anyone passionate about making games could submit a port of a game of this calibre to Steam, and then come out with this half-hearted "well, we tried" attitude to fixing it.

												I do not reccommend anyone buy this game on PC. Get it for console. The story is great if you have been following the games since Arkham Asylum.  The combat it more diverse due to the introduction of new moves and gadgets. The batmobile is a huge plus. I played this game the day it came out and fought thru the issues. number of helpful: 10 of 10 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												Definitely the worst port I have ever played. The reviews are all truthful in how poorly it runs. The stuttering is out of control making me think that the game has frozen in some parts, mostly when the batmobile is involved or I am gliding. The  stuttering can in some cases then throw the audio out of sync in cutscenes by as long as a few seconds. A lot of textures on walls, doors, or panels don't fill in making it look like it has textures out of the ps2 era. There are the least amount of graphical options I have seen in a PC game.In terms of an Arkham game, it is mediocre at best. Nothing of the story all that compelling and the game seems much more empty than other Arkham games. The emphasis on outside environments rather than strategic indoor sequences that actually made me feel like Batman in the other games make this game lack in memorable Batman sequences. Overall, this game needs a decrease in price and Rocksteady and Iron Galaxy should be absolutely ashamed in how horrible this port is and how they have treated PC games as second class gamers.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												Ok, let's start off. First of all, I'm not going to go into detail about the numerous performance issues I've experienced. You can find all of them in other people's reviews. I'm having the same problems everyone else is, and I won't elaborate. Seriously, Rocksteady?It's not just the fact that the performance issues are atrocious itself that's the problem I have with this release, though. The hype train for this game was moving faster than the Enterprise at warp speed, ok, and it was the size of 3 multiverses. Not only that, but the game was even delayed for a month, presumably to ward off ♥♥♥♥♥♥ releases like this one, and it obviously flopped horrendously. You can't honestly tell me that you tested this pc port and greenlit it for release, which is bs, because you knew how heavily anticipated this game was.  There's not that much more to say, to be honest. This is apocalyptically horrible and unacceptable by any standard, let alone Rocksteady's. Until this is fixed in its entirety, I refuse to touch this game in any form, and I would extend to anyone reading this review the same advice; do not buy this until it has been completely rectified. Onto the final point of this review, does anyone have an ETA on when this is going to be fixed? How long did it take for The Witcher 3's release to be repaired, and is Rocksteady working on Arkham Knight's  right now? The reason I ask is because knowing how long it took to patch Witcher may give me an estimate on this game's fix.  Please leave a response if  you have an answer to any of these questions, I would massively appreciate it.EDIT: WOW! Ok, so going even further into the ♥♥♥♥♥torm. This is just great. People are actually defending these devs? Are you kidding me? Everyone's who's defending this♥♥♥♥♥♥is saying things like, "Broken PC ports should be expected at this point, it comes with the territory." ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. That might be the acceptable standard for a game published by activision or EA, but with Rocksteady/ WB this should not be tolerable, especially considering the game we're talking about. Releasing a broken product at full price is not acceptable. and SHOULD NOT be the norm!  There is no argument to be had there. Anyone who thinks there is should go see a psychologist. This is just plain wrong, and needs to be protested.

number of helpful: 23 of 34 people (68%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 4, 2016
												This game in its current state is more than playable. I run an Intel i7 with 8 gigs of ram and a 4 gig GTX 960 and average around 55 FPS in 1080p on Win 7. There are some frame drops at certain times where a lot is going on but really not that big of a deal. The graphics are done with extreme detail even down to the assets. I understand the complaint from those who pre-ordered as I would not be happy either. Now I am not saying it is okay but we all make mistakes. Now to rate the game as a whole for what it is worth without a childish hop on the bandwagon review. I will talk about this game going forward for anyone who would like to purchase it.The open world design grant a great backbone to this games development which also subsequently allows for DLC to be added into the game seamlessly. The vanilla "story" if you will is great with a twisted plot that any comic/batman fan should enjoy. You can attack many different scenarios in a way that suits your playing style. If your bored you can wander the streets like in a GTA game and cause havoc or in this case beat up some bad guys. Now how does the game run. My GPU is NOT overclocked and I get 55+ FPS 90% of the time. I can only imagine a 970/980/TITAN to be way better. This is with all my settings maxed out on high with the exception of the nvidia interactive smoke, fog, rain, etc which is disabled. Now if you don't have a 900 series GPU or 4+ gigs VRAM this is where it might get tricky. I does use most of my VRAM. I don't have a 750 ti so I can't compare. As I don't know how it will run on 2 gigs VRAM or the older GPUs. It may be a struggle. I can say that anything above a 960 4GB shouldn't get a complaint.I suggest every future reviewer leave your system specifications in the review so it can be judged for accuracy.

number of helpful: 11 of 12 people (92%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												I have attempted running this game on a GTX 970 with an i5 4690k, and another system with a GTX 680 and an i7 4770k.I do not usually write reviews for games, but this is a case where one is warranted from everyone who has had problems with the game thus far. I for one was able to play through about 20% of the campaign with variable framerate between 20 and 60 fps, but now cannot launch the game at all. A verification through steam did not fix this issue. Capping the Framerate again did not fix this issue. Launching from another computer does not fix this issue. This is at the least incriminating state, Rocksteady spitting in the face of PC Gaming and at the most, a deceitful falsely marketed (NVIDIA’s Play at 60fps GameWorks Preview) cash grab from a portion of their audience that has supported this franchise from its inception.Batman Arkham Knight is, as you know by now, capped at 30fps, a setting you can turn off, but one that is not entirely helpful with a frame rate as varying as it has been on my end. It is best played at its capped frame rate as the drops are less frequent and far less jarring. Textures fade into their high resolution version long after actually approaching them and multiple bugs turn this into a port worse than Unity.The game itself, well it’s a Batman Game. If you enjoyed the previous Batman Games from their incredible combat that has been stolen and implemented into some other great games, to the detective mode for solving and stopping murderous plots, this game is what you want. It’s the previous Batman games, but improved in their mechanics. The hits feel hard and connect with great audio and visual representation, and it’s hard to believe that the Bat is not killing these people as he runs them over with the Bat Mobile... The world feels large, but that feeling began to leave me as I dashed around corners in the Bat Mobile noticing the same locations I had seen. As the game went on the world felt smaller and smaller. It is no Witcher 3. Like I said before, I was only able to get around 20% of the story done, so I cannot comment on the merits of it, but as far as I have seen, it has been alright. Typical Batman plot lines, but plotlines I do not mind seeing again. Scarecrows fear toxin does its thing in this game so far in a more subdued fashion. I can only hope that these sequences become more hallucinogenic as time goes on. And hopefully that time will be soon as I would like to continue playing this game, but unfortunately cannot even launch it now on the GTX 680 System.This was a game that I was so looking forward to. It is terribly disappointing that this had to happen like this. All I can say is “♥♥♥♥ Dave Lang!”
